outputs.output_descr:
On Monday the 4th of January 2010, two earthquakes measuring 6.5 and 7.2 on the Richter scale struck near Rendova and Tetepare Islands, some 88km SSE of Gizo, in the Western Province. The 7.2 earthquake generated a 4.5-5m tsunami that hit the southern and northern coast of the Rendova Island and nearby Tetepare. The disaster claimed no lives but caused extensive damage to shelters, schools, clinics and water supply.
Through this project, UNDP will assist the Solomon Islands Government in the following areas: rebuilding the livelihoods of the affected communities; assisting NDMO on risk assessment given ongoing risk and the possibility of flashfloods; and establishing a bottom-up early warning system for geological hazards.

1. Rehabilitated livelihoods of the affected communities 
2. Enhanced  a gender base disaster mitigation/management capacity in NDMO

project_title: recovery assistance for earthquake & tsunami rendova
